intro: Sartidia vanderystii, commonly known as the Vanderyst's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its slender, grass-like stems are often clustered and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Sartidia vanderystii produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the Cyperaceae family.
